channel.title: Kaggle on Flora's
channel.description: Recent content in Kaggle on Flora's

item.title: How to be a Kaggle Master?
item.description: How to be a Kaggle Master Kaggle Combo x3: Feature Engineering, Model Tuning, Model Ensemble Data Preprocessing: Missing values imputation: Numeric Features Impute with mean for normal distributed feature Impute with median for skewed distribution (reduce the impacts of outliers) Categorical Features Majority Imputation Supervised Learning Imputation Regression/Classification XGBoost/LightGBM: Missing values are gracefully treated by considering missing values as candidate for tree splitting point.

item.title: How to read csv files under .gz in Kaggle kernel?
item.description: It took me long time to figure it out. Say if the files’ directory in the Kaggle kernel looks like this: competitive-data-science-predict-future-sales sales_train.csv.gz sales_train.csv When I try to list all the files in the directory, I realize that there’s no need to unzip the .gz file in order to get the .csv files, since import os data_dir = '/kaggle/input/competitive-data-science-predict-future-sales' os.listdir(data_dir) the output is: ['test.csv', 'item_categories.csv', 'sales_train.csv', 'sample_submission.csv', 'items.csv', 'shops.csv'] Thus in order to use the .
